title: Bugsplat for a week
body: Please help me, I have reinstalled League of Legends 3 times and still have not found a solution. I have attached a picture, which may help. Please help...

replies.body: If you have WINDOWS 10 and your XBOX application is running, enter it and look through the settings. When you get into the settings look for anything named Game DVR and disable it. Once disabled, you can play any game that was started to crash out of nowhere, league of legends included.**

Assuming these bugsplats are occurring while the game is loading or during play, then you might be facing bad game files or even drivers failing to render the game.  Go over each step of the [game crash](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201761974-Bug-Splat-and-Game-Crashes+) to both tune up your PC and troubleshoot this towards a fix.  Let me know if you have any questions!

The problem is that your worthless BugSplat doesn't actually point to an issue in a clear, concise manner like literally every other  bug reporting tool on the internet. Instead of saying, "Oh, your game crashed for X reason, so Y fix should take care of the problem", it creates a bunch of log files that actually don't contain any relevant information. Which results in the issue above: posting a link to a FAQ article with "repair steps" most of us have the brains to automatically fix because we understand basic computer maintenance. And when those linked repair steps don't actually work for people like me, your support staff pretty much tell me I'm just out of luck. I will never understand why on earth Riot still uses BugSplat...

Same problem here.

I have gone over each of the steps, up to and including re-installing my windows, after de-fragmenting the hard drive and checking the RAM for damaged sectors.

Needless to say, nothing wrong on my end that I can find.

Problem started apprx. a week ago and persists.
Same issue here. Needs to be fixed NOW.
